reviewText: Another great episode. This episode narrates the growth of the Gospel in China. There are an estimated  60-80 million believers in China and growing but the mission field is huge since there are about 1.3 billion people in China. Keesee is a master story teller and starts this episode following the steps of Hudson Taylor who said that if he had a thousand lives he would give it to China, no he said, to Christ. A few things I learned, besides the great need of the Gospel in China, 1. American evangelicalism has brought a lot of confusion to China. 2. There aren't super star believers. All believers share Christ with those they meet. 3. The Gospel is for all, even those that China considers outcasts with disabilities. The Lord is building his church in China but we need to pray for more laborers. Those of us who live in America have it too easy. It is time to open our eyes to the huge mission field we have not only here in America but in the world.

These hour long videos are amazing insights into the Christian work being done in the world's most difficult places. I've supported this humble ministry since I saw the first one. Tim Keesee is a great producer, writer, and humble servant. I'll happily recommend any of his work.
This was an amazing account of courage.
purchased as a gift, but love these front line missionaries and they work they are doing to take the gospel to the unchurched peoples of the world.

This DVD shows both the difficulties and the successes of native Chinese Christians working in the face of state sponsored persecution to share the good news of Christ's forgiveness. Excellent report from the front lines of the spiritual war of God's goodness vs evil.
Well documented and videographed. Great tool for sharing with others about the impact that Christianity (and missionaries) have had, and continue to have, in the PRC.
